GUNPOWDER.Definition: an explosive mixture of substances in the form of a powder, used for making explosive devices and fireworks

TREASON.Definition: (the crime of) showing no loyalty to your country, especially by helping its enemies or trying to defeat its government

PLOT.Definition: a secret plan made by several people to do something that is wrong, harmful, or not legal, especially to do damage to a person or a government

BONFIRE.Definition: a large fire that is made outside to burn unwanted things, or for pleasure

EFFIGY.Definition: a model or other object that represents someone, especially one of a hated person that is hanged or burned in a public place

DISPLAY.Definition: to arrange something or a collection of things so that it can be seen by the public

FATE.Definition: what happens to a particular person or thing, especially something final or negative, such as death or defeat

PAINT A PICTURE.Definition: to describe or show something in a particular way

ON THE THRONE.Definition: to be the king or queen at the time

INHERITED.Definition: received from someone who has died

PERSECUTED.Definition: treat someone unfairly or cruelly over a long period of time because of their race, religion, or political beliefs, or to annoy someone by refusing to leave them alone

REIGN.Definition: to be the king or queen of a country

TAKE MATTERS INTO THEIR OWN HANDS.Definition: to deal with a problem yourself because the people who should have dealt with it have failed to do so

ACTIVISTS.Definition: people who believe strongly in political or social change and take part in activities such as public protests to try to make this happen

SNEAK.Definition: to go somewhere secretly, or to take someone or something somewhere secretly

METICULOUSLY.Definition: in a way that shows great care and attention to detail

SMUGGLE.Definition: to take things or people to or from a place secretly and often illegally

CELLAR.Definition: a room under the ground floor of a building, usually used for storing things

BARRELS.Definition: a large container, made of wood, metal, or plastic, with a flat top and bottom and curved sides that make it fatter in the middle

MATCH.Definition: a short, thin stick made of wood or cardboard and covered with a special chemical at one end that burns when rubbed firmly against a rough surface

BLOWN TO SMITHEREENS.Definition: blown into lots of very small pieces, completely blown up

INSTALL.Definition: to put someone in an important job or position

BARON.Definition: a low-ranking male member of the nobility (= group of people from a high social class)‍

RADIUS.Definition: (the length of) a straight line joining the centre of a circle to its edge or the centre of a sphere to its surface

GAINED A REPUTATION.Definition: was known for a particular thing

FELLOW.Definition: used of people or a person with whom you share something, esp. the same kind of job, interest, or experience

LONGED.Definition: wanted for a long period of time

FUSE.Definition: a string or piece of paper connected to a firework or other explosive product by which it is lit, or a device inside a bomb that causes it to explode after a fixed length of time or when it hits or is near something

INTERROGATED.Definition: to ask someone a lot of questions for a long time in order to get information, sometimes using threats or violence

CONSPIRATORS.Definition: people who plan secretly with other people to do something bad, illegal, or against someone’s wishes

HIGH.Definition: (in relation to 'treason') the worst kind of

COMMITS.Definition: to do something illegal or something that is considered wrong

EXECUTED.Definition: to kill someone as a legal punishment

DEEP STATE.Definition: organisations such as military, police, or political groups that are said to work secretly in order to protect particular interests and to rule a country without being elected

SET-UP.Definition: a situation in which someone is tricked into doing something or is made to seem guilty of something they did not do

BLAME.Definition: to say or think that someone or something did something wrong or is responsible for something bad happening

ENTICING.Definition: Something that is enticing attracts you to it by offering you advantages or pleasure

GENERIC.Definition: shared by, typical of, or relating to a whole group of similar things, rather than to any particular thing

QUINTESSENTIALLY.Definition: in a way that is the most typical example or most important part of something

PERCEPTION.Definition: a belief or opinion, often held by many people and based on how things seem

COMMIT.Definition: to do something illegal or something that is considered wrong

CLASSIFY.Definition: to divide things or people into groups according to their type, or to say which group or type something or someone belongs to

MORPHED.Definition: to gradually change, or change someone or something, from one thing to another

ASPIRATIONAL.Definition: someone or something that a group of people want to be like, or hold as a positive example

ANTI-ESTABLISHMENT.Definition: against the powerful people who control a country or an organisation, against the status quo

ANARCHY.Definition: a situation in which there is no organisation and control, especially in society, because there is no effective government

DISASSOCIATE.Definition: to consider as separate and not related

ROMANTICISED.Definition: to talk about something in a way that makes it sound better than it really is, or to believe that something is better than it really is

ICON.Definition: a very famous person or thing considered as representing a set of beliefs or a way of life

PROFOUND.Definition: felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way
